Description: Created by our quants, for our quants. Our analytics tools are trusted daily by over a thousand quantitative developers at Goldman Sachs to manage our global trading business.
Our business covers all asset classes. Our financial toolkit is designed from the ground up to be a complete solution for all markets, delivered through an intuitive interface.
Leverage models and datasets which have been tested and refined through decades of experience at the center of global derivatives markets. Use what we use.

FeatureTitle: A New Face for the Firm
Description: Take a tour of the design features of Goldman Sans, a custom typeface designed for the needs of digital finance.
Learn about the research and testing that went into creating our color palette to ensure versatility, accessibility, consistency, and scalability.
Knowing how and why we design informs what we design.

FeatureTitle: But I must explain to you
Description: But I must explain to you how all this mistaken idea of denouncing pleasure and praising pain was born and I will give you a complete account of the system, and expound the actual teachings of the g

eat explorer of the truth, the master-builder of human happiness. No one rejects, dislikes, or avoids pleasure itself, because it is pleasure, but because those who do not know how to pursue pleasure r
ationally encounter consequences that are extremely painful. Nor again is there anyone who loves or pursues or desires to obtain pain of itself, because it is pain, but occasionally circumstances

Description: occur in which toil and pain can procure him some great pleasure. To take a trivial example, whi

FeatureTitle: h of us ever undertakes l
Description: h of us ever undertakes laborious physical exercise, except to obtain some advantage from it? But who has any right to find fault with a man who chooses to enjoy a pleasure that has no a
noying consequences, or one who avoids a pain that produces no resultant pleasure?

FeatureTitle: On the other hand, we den
Description: On the other hand, we denounce with righteous indignation and dislike men who are so beguiled and demoralized by the charms of pleasure of the m

ment, so blinded by desire, that they cannot foresee the pain and trouble that are bound to ensue; and equal blame belongs to those who fail in their duty through weakness of will, which is the same as saying through shrinking from toil and p
. These cases are perfectly simple and easy to distinguish. In a free hour, when our power of choice is untrammelled and
